All Classes

Class Description
CdupCommand
Handle the FTP command "CDUP".
ClientFtp
Class which characterizes the session with a client and allows the command exchange between the client and server.
Command
Represents the commands implemented on the server
CommandHandler
Define what a command handler should do.
CommandHandlerFactory
Create command handler to handle FTP commands.
CwdCommand
Handle the FTP command "CWD".
DataSocket
Class which characterizes the data channel with a client and allows data exchange between the client and server.
DeleCommand
Handle the FTP command "DELE".
IllegalCommandException
Exception throw when an unimplemented command is received by the server
ListCommand
Handle the FTP command "LIST".
Main
Application entry point with 3 arguments : 1 - the path of the local repository of the FTP server (mandatory), 2 - the port number (mandatory), 3 - the number of users who can connect simultaneously, this number is 5 by default (optionnal)
MkdCommand
Handle the FTP command "MKD".
PassCommand
Handle the FTP command "PASS password".
PasvCommand
Handle the FTP command "PASV ".
PortCommand
Handle the FTP command "PORT ".
PwdCommand
Handle the FTP command "PWD".
QuitCommand
Handle the FTP command "QUIT".
Response
Represents the responses sent by the server to the client according to the commands sent
RetrCommand
Handle the FTP command "RETR".
RmdCommand
Handle the FTP command "RMD".
RnfrCommand
Handle the FTP command "RNFR" (rename from).
RntoCommand
Handle the FTP command "RNTO" (rename to).
ServerFtp
Singleton class which creates a serverSocket on a specific port waits for connections as long as it is not closed
ServerSocketException
Exception thrown when something went wrong on the ServerFtp class
StorCommand
Handle the FTP command "STOR".
SystCommand
Handle SYST command which ask informations about the server's operating system.
User
The purpose of this class is to manage all the statuses of users trying to connect to the server.
UserCommand
Handle the FTP command "USER username".
UserStatus
Represents the different states of a user of the system
WrongArgumentException
Exception thrown when there is a bad argument when launching the executable
